feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA1/SGP1][Dedicated Servers] - Network equipment version upgrade
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 29, 21:00 UTC  -  Nov 30, 00:00 UTC

Aug 24, 17:44 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 29/11/2023 21:00 UTC
End time : 30/11/2023 00:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a version upgrade on multiple network equipment.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - End of Life Real Time Monitoring APIv6
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 7, 09:30 - 10:00 UTC

Sep 22, 11:30 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/11/2023 09:30 UTC
End time : 07/11/2023 10:00 UTC
Service impact : The End of Life of Real Time Monitoring (RTM) for baremetal is scheduled for the 7th of November 2023.
Few customers will be impacted (less than 10) and will stop be able to monitor their dedicated servers via the APIv6. This will impact APIv6 calls /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/statistics.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][NAS HA] - NFSv4.1 support maintenance
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Oct 10, 04:30 UTC  -  Oct 12, 13:00 UTC

Sep 12, 08:49 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 10/10/2023 04:30 UTC
End time : 12/10/2023 13:00 UTC
Service impact : During the maintenance, a restart of the server-side NFS daemon will be made.
So a service interruption of less than a second may be observed
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to make NFSv4.1 automatically supported by default on all SSD-based NAS-HA over the current NFSv3.

Some changes might be observed from cutomers side which are as follow:
* For your future NAS-HA orders, NFSv4.1 will be used by default when mounting your file shares.
If needed, you will be able to choose between v3 and v4.1 when mounting your shares using the mount utility.
* For existing ones, it will depend on what you did initially:
- If you didn't force NFSv3 when mounting your shares: NFSv4.1 will be applied if the server or the client service is restarted.
You can decide to force NFSv3 using the same mount utility.
- If you forced NFSv3 when mounting your shares: nothing will change, you will keep your original configuration.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Baremetal] - Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Oct 3, 08:00 UTC  -  Nov 3, 10:50 UTC

Aug 2, 14:39 UTC
Scheduled - Start time: 03/10/2023 08:00 UTC
End time: 03/11/2023 10:50 UTC
Service impact: The Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) will no longer be available after 03/10/2023
Service improvement: The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) for all Baremetal products.
Customers should start using the new Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer).
The old Web interface is no longer present on the new version.
Please follow this procedure to troubleshoot hardware problems: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-dedicated-servers-hardware-diagnostics?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0043506
